#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=A Merry Evening with a Distant Relative

#Text=I was not so unreasonable as to be prejudiced against the duke ’s keeper because he disliked my complexion ; and if I had been , his most civil and obliging conduct ( as it seemed to me to be ) next morning would have disarmed me .

#Text=Hearing that I was bound for Strelsau , he came to see me while I was breakfasting , and told me that a sister of his who had married a well-to-do tradesman and lived in the capital , had invited him to occupy a room in her house .
#Text=He had gladly accepted , but now found that his duties would not permit of his absence .
#Text=He begged therefore that , if such humble ( though , as he added , clean and comfortable ) lodgings would satisfy me , I would take his place .
#Text=He pledged his sister ’s acquiescence , and urged the inconvenience and crowding to which I should be subject in my journeys to and from Strelsau the next day .
#Text=I accepted his offer without a moment ’s hesitation , and he went off to telegraph to his sister , while I packed up and prepared to take the next train .

#Text=But I still hankered after the forest and the hunting-lodge , and when my little maid told me that I could , by walking ten miles or so through the forest , hit the railway at a roadside station , I decided to send my luggage direct to the address which Johann had given , take my walk , and follow to Strelsau myself .

#Text=Johann had gone off and was not aware of the change in my plans ; but , as its only effect was to delay my arrival at his sister ’s for a few hours , there was no reason for troubling to inform him of it .
#Text=Doubtless the good lady would waste no anxiety on my account .

#Text=I took an early luncheon , and , having bidden my kind entertainers farewell , promising to return to them on my way home , I set out to climb the hill that led to the Castle , and thence to the forest of Zenda .
#Text=Half an hour ’s leisurely walking brought me to the Castle .
#Text=It had been a fortress in old days , and the ancient keep was still in good preservation and very imposing .

#Text=Behind it stood another portion of the original castle , and behind that again , and separated from it by a deep and broad moat , which ran all round the old buildings , was a handsome modern chateau , erected by the last king , and now forming the country residence of the Duke of Strelsau .

#Text=The old and the new portions were connected by a drawbridge , and this indirect mode of access formed the only passage between the old building and the outer world ; but leading to the modern chateau there was a broad and handsome avenue .

#Text=It was an ideal residence : when “ Black Michael ” desired company , he could dwell in his chateau ; if a fit of misanthropy seized him , he had merely to cross the bridge and draw it up after him ( it ran on rollers ) , and nothing short of a regiment and a train of artillery could fetch him out .
#Text=I went on my way , glad that poor Black Michael , though he could not have the throne or the princess , had , at least , as fine a residence as any prince in Europe .
#Text=Soon I entered the forest , and walked on for an hour or more in its cool sombre shade .
#Text=The great trees enlaced with one another over my head , and the sunshine stole through in patches as bright as diamonds , and hardly bigger .

#Text=I was enchanted with the place , and , finding a felled tree-trunk , propped my back against it , and stretching my legs out gave myself up to undisturbed contemplation of the solemn beauty of the woods and to the comfort of a good cigar .

#Text=And when the cigar was finished and I had ( I suppose ) inhaled as much beauty as I could , I went off into the most delightful sleep , regardless of my train to Strelsau and of the fast-waning afternoon .
#Text=To remember a train in such a spot would have been rank sacrilege .

#Text=Instead of that , I fell to dreaming that I was married to the Princess Flavia and dwelt in the Castle of Zenda , and beguiled whole days with my love in the glades of the forest -- which made a very pleasant dream .

#Text=In fact , I was just impressing a fervent kiss on the charming lips of the princess , when I heard ( and the voice seemed at first a part of the dream ) someone exclaim , in rough strident tones .
#Text=“ Why , the devil ’s in it ! Shave him , and he ’d be the King ! ”

#Text=The idea seemed whimsical enough for a dream : by the sacrifice of my heavy moustache and carefully pointed imperial , I was to be transformed into a monarch ! I was about to kiss the princess again , when I arrived ( very reluctantly ) at the conclusion that I was awake .
#Text=I opened my eyes , and found two men regarding me with much curiosity .
#Text=Both wore shooting costumes and carried guns .
#Text=One was rather short and very stoutly built , with a big bullet-shaped head , a bristly grey moustache , and small pale-blue eyes , a trifle bloodshot .
#Text=The other was a slender young fellow , of middle height , dark in complexion , and bearing himself with grace and distinction .
#Text=I set the one down as an old soldier : the other for a gentleman accustomed to move in good society , but not unused to military life either .
#Text=It turned out afterwards that my guess was a good one .
